Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Impact: The availability impact is Complete. The confidentiality impact is Complete. The integrity impact is Complete
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Impact: The availability impact is Complete. The confidentiality impact is Complete. The integrity impact is Complete
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package glibc-headers.x86_64: glibc contains a vulnerability that allows specially crafted LD_LIBRARY_PATH values to manipulate the heap/stack causing them to alias potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution. This affects glibc 2.25 and earlier.. Vulnerability Severity: Based on the Halo account settings the vulnerability is critical.  It is a CVE from 2017 and its qualitative severity ranking (based on PCI guidelines) is high
Threat: Local vulnerability with Low access complexity requiring athentication level None
Impact: The availability impact is Complete. The confidentiality impact is Complete. The integrity impact is Complete
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: An issue was discovered in the size of the stack guard page on Linux specifically a 4k stack guard page is not sufficiently large and can be "jumped" over (the stack guard page is bypassed) this affects Linux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier (the stackguard page was introduced in 2010).. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Threat: Local vulnerability with Low access complexity requiring athentication level None
Impact: The availability impact is Complete. The confidentiality impact is Complete. The integrity impact is Complete
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: An issue was discovered in the size of the stack guard page on Linux specifically a 4k stack guard page is not sufficiently large and can be "jumped" over (the stack guard page is bypassed) this affects Linux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier (the stackguard page was introduced in 2010).. Refer to references  https://www.suse.com/support/kb/doc/?id=7020973 https://www.suse.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000364/ https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000364 http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038724 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99130

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. Vulnerability Type: Local vulnerability with Low access complexity requiring athentication level None
Vulnerability Severity: Based on the Halo account settings the vulnerability is critical.  It is a CVE from 2017 and its qualitative severity ranking (based on PCI guidelines) is high
Threat: Local vulnerability with Low access complexity requiring athentication level None
Impact: The availability impact is Complete. The confidentiality impact is Complete. The integrity impact is Complete
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package glibc.x86_64: glibc contains a vulnerability that allows specially crafted LD_LIBRARY_PATH values to manipulate the heap/stack causing them to alias potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution. Please note that additional hardening changes have been made to glibc to prevent manipulation of stack and heap memory but these issues are not directly exploitable as such they have not been given a CVE. This affects glibc 2.25 and earlier.. Vulnerability Severity: Based on the Halo account settings the vulnerability is critical.  It is a CVE from 2017 and its qualitative severity ranking (based on PCI guidelines) is high
Threat: Local vulnerability with Low access complexity requiring athentication level None
Impact: The availability impact is Complete. The confidentiality impact is Complete. The integrity impact is Complete
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. Vulnerability Severity: Based on the Halo account settings the vulnerability is critical.  It is a CVE from 2017 and its qualitative severity ranking (based on PCI guidelines) is high
Threat: Local vulnerability with Low access complexity requiring athentication level None
Impact: The availability impact is Complete. The confidentiality impact is Complete. The integrity impact is Complete
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: An issue was discovered in the size of the stack guard page on Linux specifically a 4k stack guard page is not sufficiently large and can be "jumped" over (the stack guard page is bypassed) this affects Linux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier (the stackguard page was introduced in 2010).. Refer to references  https://www.suse.com/support/kb/doc/?id=7020973 https://www.suse.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000364/ https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000364 http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038724 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99130

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-devel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-headers.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel-tools.x86_64: An issue was discovered in the size of the stack guard page on Linux specifically a 4k stack guard page is not sufficiently large and can be "jumped" over (the stack guard page is bypassed) this affects Linux Kernel versions 4.11.5 and earlier (the stackguard page was introduced in 2010).. Refer to references  https://www.suse.com/support/kb/doc/?id=7020973 https://www.suse.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000364/ https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000364 http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038724 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99130

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package kernel.x86_64: The offset2lib patch as used by the Linux Kernel contains a vulnerability if RLIMIT_STACK is set to RLIM_INFINITY and 1 Gigabyte of memory is allocated (the maximum under the 1/4 restriction) then the stack will be grown down to 0x80000000 and as the PIE binary is mapped above 0x80000000 the minimum distance between the end of the PIE binary's read-write segment and the start of the stack becomes small enough that the stack guard page can be jumped over by an attacker. This affects Linux Kernel version 4.11.5. This is a different issue than CVE-2017-1000370 and CVE-2017-1000365. This issue appears to be limited to i386 based systems.. Refer to references  https://www.qualys.com/2017/06/19/stack-clash/stack-clash.txt https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2017-1000371 http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99131

Threat: Network vulnerability with Medium access complexity requiring athentication level None
Impact: The availability impact is None. The confidentiality impact is None. The integrity impact is Partial
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package Internet Explorer: The TLS protocol 1.2 and earlier when a DHE_EXPORT ciphersuite is enabled on a server but not on a client does not properly convey a DHE_EXPORT choice which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct cipher-downgrade attacks by rewriting a ClientHello with DHE replaced by DHE_EXPORT and then rewriting a ServerHello with DHE_EXPORT replaced by DHE aka the "Logjam" issue.. Impact: The availability impact is None. The confidentiality impact is Partial. The integrity impact is None
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package Internet Explorer: Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 through 11 allows user-assisted remote attackers to read the clipboard contents via crafted web script aka "Internet Explorer Clipboard Information Disclosure Vulnerability.". Threat: Network vulnerability with Medium access complexity requiring athentication level None
Impact: The availability impact is None. The confidentiality impact is Partial. The integrity impact is None
Vulnerable packages: Patch vulnerable package Internet Explorer: The RC4 algorithm as used in the TLS protocol and SSL protocol does not properly combine state data with key data during the initialization phase which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct plaintext-recovery attacks against the initial bytes of a stream by sniffing network traffic that occasionally relies on keys affected by the Invariance Weakness and then using a brute-force approach involving LSB values aka the "Bar Mitzvah" issue..
